docs.lead_paragraph: Governor Cuomo laid out a legislative program today that included proposals to clean up the environment, provide jobs for welfare applicants, spur economic development and build housing for the homeless. He said the agenda - a combination of new approaches and old programs he has pressed during his three years in office - would carry New York State ''from recovery to resurgence.'' In his annual State of the State Message to the joint session of the Legislature, the Democratic Governor made these proposals: * An economic development program that included six ''opportunity zones'' - distressed areas for which state and local incentives would be clustered to help business expand. * Efforts to steer welfare applicants into private employment, ''real jobs in exchange for wage subsidies from the state.'' * A $1.45 billion bond issue, most of it to clean up hazardous waste sites.

headline.main: CUOMO, IN STATE OF STATE MESSAGE, OFFERS ENVIRONMENT AND JOB PLANS
